image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson wanted "nothing" to do with her extended family, according to online messages allegedly sent seven months before the fatal lunch at her home.

title.children: "They're a lost cause": messages about in-laws shown in mushroom trial

image.altText: Fire trucks in a street.

props.synopsis: Firefighters had to break in to a property in Chadstone, in Melbourne's south-east, to rescue a woman and two children. All three are in hospital with critical injuries.

title.children: Fire that left woman, two children critical sparked by exploding gas cylinder, police say

image.altText: A photo is displayed on the big screens during Robert Walls Funeral Service at the MCG.

props.synopsis: A decorated player, a ruthless coach and an insightful media performer, Robert Walls is remembered as a "big softie" by his family.

title.children: 'A fortunate life': AFL giant Walls remembered at moving funeral service

image.altText: Two women with sunglasses in the foreground and a man in the background

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman has been sentenced to seven and a half years in prison for setting a friend on fire after a night consuming drugs and alcohol.

title.children: Cheers as woman jailed for setting friend on fire while partying

image.altText: GettyImages-2216414273

props.synopsis: Bailey Smith faces his old side in a highly anticipated Cats-Bulldogs clash. Follow live.

title.children: 'Hopefully we see them in September': Smith already eyeing rematch after close win

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Hopefully we see them in September': Smith wants another Dogs clash

image.altText: Adam Selwood (left) and Joel Selwood (right) smiling and posing for a photograph together.

props.synopsis: Geelong AFL champion Joel Selwood has posted a short tribute to his brother Adam, who died last week aged 41.

title.children: Joel Selwood posts tribute following sudden death of brother Adam

image.altText: Carly Findlay sits in a hospital bed. She wears a knitted blue hat with a yellow flower and has a colourful handmade blanket on.

props.synopsis: Carly Findlay knew cancer treatment would be rough. So she made her friends a list.

title.children: Helping someone through cancer treatment? This is what helped me

image.altText: A police officer takes a picture of a road. He is holding a camera.

props.synopsis: The body was discovered on the side of the Princes Freeway in Morwell, about two hours south-east of Melbourne.

title.children: Police searching for driver who fatally struck Traralgon dad and drove away

image.altText: A spacious foyer with high ceilings and white walls featuring artwork.

props.synopsis: The 138-year-old Bendigo Art Gallery is set to close later this year for a major makeover that is expected to take two years to complete.

title.children: Bendigo Art Gallery set to close for $45m redevelopment

image.altText: Victorian players in a huddle during a VFLW vs SANFLW game.

props.synopsis: The Office for Women in Sport and Recreation and the Preventing Violence Through Sport Grants Program were both axed in Victorian Treasurer Jaclyn Symes's first budget.

title.children: Victoria axes Australian-first programs boosting gender equity in sport

image.altText: A kelpie farm dog drinks from a water trough on a farm, surrounded by dry, barren paddocks.

props.synopsis: Flooding rain in parts of Australia and forecast local showers during the coming week are unlikely to help Victoria's drought-stricken regions in any significant way, the Bureau of Meteorology says.

title.children: Victoria is in a historic drought. Here's why the NSW deluge won't help

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's alleged internet records have been shown to jurors in her triple-murder trial, which show a death cap mushroom web page was visited more than a year before the fatal lunch.

title.children: Death cap mushroom web page visited 14 months before Erin Patterson's fatal lunch

image.altText: A woman in a colourful patterned shirt stands on a beach next to a pile of tree limbs. We see her from behind.

props.synopsis: When her teenage son's mental health spiralled, a mother turned to the system for help — but it wasn't available when she needed it most.

title.children: Mother's search for help exposes cracks in regional mental health care

image.altText: man walking outside with phone in hand

props.synopsis: Witnesses tell a court in Melbourne they were left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket after Mr Stevens failed to build swimming pools they had paid him for.

title.children: Ex-AFL player accused of $170k deception over undelivered family pools

image.altText: Three gaming machines sit empty in a pub.

props.synopsis: MPs and gambling reform advocates are furious after the Allan government missed its deadline to trial pre-commitment cards.

title.children: Pokies reforms delayed by years after Vic government backdown

image.altText: Tomatoes hanging on vines at a tomato farm.

props.synopsis: A destructive exotic tomato plant disease that had a major impact in South Australia and Victoria has been linked to New South Wales for the first time.

title.children: Latest devastating tomato plant virus detection linked to NSW nursery

image.altText: A tent on a river bank with a river in the background.

props.synopsis: A free camping program panned by tourism operators and plagued by ghost bookings and rubbish dumping is abandoned by the state government.

title.children: Ghost bookers bring axe down on Victoria's free-camping experiment

image.altText: A house with police tape around it

props.synopsis: An inquest has found the officers could not have foreseen that Phillip Reidy would consume a lethal substance during the July 2024 arrest.

title.children: Police cleared by coroner over poison death during Kyneton arrest

image.altText: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan reacts after Victorian Treasurer Jaclyn Symes deliver state budget

props.synopsis: For a document that pours billions of dollars into concrete infrastructure, the Victorian Budget figures feel very shaky. And the numbers get scary, fast.

title.children: Buy or decry the budget, but the Vic govt won't shift from its vision

image.altText: CFA members holding signs outside parliament

props.synopsis: Victorian councils say they do not have the resources to collect or enforce a new tax which has sparked protests in Melbourne and the regions.

title.children: Councils join forces to oppose Victoria's emergency services levy

image.altText: Close-up of a white marble statue of a woman with folded hands, carved into a temple pillar

props.synopsis: A community of 750 first-generation migrants has spent a decade fasting daily and raising millions to construct Victoria's first Jain temple, using special methods to honour ancient traditions while meeting modern building codes.

title.children: After a decade of fasting and fundraising a Jain temple takes shape

image.altText: A group of Indigenous dancers in traditional outfits and body paint, stand with Richmond and Essendon AFL players on the MCG.

props.synopsis: Two of footy's Indigenous greats hope the Sir Doug Nicholls Round can spark action to reverse the falling number of First Nations players on AFL club lists.

title.children: Legends demand AFL action on falling Indigenous player numbers

image.altText: A dark cloud over the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

props.synopsis: As the Hunter and Mid North Coast regions reel from devastating floods, there is now high confidence the soaking will shift south during the coming days and bring drought relief to parts of the Murray Basin.

title.children: NSW deluge to bring drought relief as it travels south

image.altText: Cows wearing electronic collars graze in green pasture

props.synopsis: The Victorian government will develop regulations to support virtual fencing for cattle, bringing the state further in line with others across Australia.

title.children: Virtual fencing one step closer for most of Australia's dairy herd

image.altText: A Carlton captain hands over the ball to a club great wearing a suit, as both men shake hands after a game.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago today, suburban VFL/AFL men's footy in Melbourne came to an end. On the anniversary of Carlton vs Melbourne at Princes Park, we talk to Anthony Koutoufides and others, looking back at the memories from suburban grounds, and how the game has changed.

title.children: 'It was hard to accept': The day the AFL said goodbye to suburban footy

image.altText: Cyndi holding her son upside-down in front of a purple mural

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly accessing their superannuation early to fund IVF treatment. The involvement of fertility clinics has some experts concerned.

title.children: How much is using superannuation to pay for IVF really costing women?

image.altText: A close up photo of Jaclyn Symes with a red background

props.synopsis: Victoria's debt is set to balloon to record levels as the state government battles to rein in spending, even as the axe looms over thousands of public sector jobs.

title.children: Victoria's debt set to hit record levels as axe looms over public service

image.altText: A shiny sign saying Ballarat Court

props.synopsis: A man has been charged a day after the body of a 70-year-old was found at a home in the western Victorian city.

title.children: Suspect charged with murder after body found in Ballarat suburb

image.altText: Bailey Smith dropping the ball to his foot, preparing a drop punt, while being chased by an opponent

props.synopsis: Bailey Smith has sat out Geelong training, further ratcheting up the hype around Thursday night's massive home AFL clash with his old club, the Western Bulldogs.

title.children: Bailey hype goes up again for massive Cats-Dogs duel

image.altText: Wind turbine on a hill

props.synopsis: Producers in the path of proposed renewables projects vow to keep developers out, as the state government pushes forward with its green energy transition.

title.children: Farmers may lock the gate on renewables in Victoria

image.altText: A snow machine shoots out white powder as snow covers the ground under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Temperatures plummeted to record lows across Victoria this week after an unseasonably warm start to autumn, with snow building in alpine regions.

title.children: Record-breaking cold snap hits Victoria after unusually warm start to May

image.altText: Actor Samuel Johnson.

props.synopsis: He has overcome a series of personal tragedies, but Gold Logie winner Samuel Johnson says he is not peddling a redemptive narrative.

title.children: Having a postie round stops Gold Logie winner Samuel Johnson from misbehaving

image.altText: Emergency service vehicles and personnel near a mountain beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: Emergency services rescued a man who fell while climbing near Mount Arapiles, west of Horsham in western Victoria.

title.children: Mountain climber recovering after 15m fall in Victoria

image.altText: Montanna Tagg

props.synopsis: As scientists explore the benefits of surfing on teenage mental health, one student has strengthened her sense of "belonging and connection".

title.children: Montana used to struggle to get out of bed. Now she's up before the sun
